This experiment demonstrates the formation of a compound because when iron filings and sulfur powder are heated, they chemically react to form iron sulfide, which is a compound with distinct properties from the original elements.
The pollution of the river can lead to serious health issues such as waterborne diseases in the community. The most likely type of pollution responsible is water pollution.
The two poles of a magnet are called the North Pole and the South Pole.
Plant cells have a rigid cell wall and a large central vacuole that help retain water, maintaining turgor pressure, which is essential for keeping the plant upright and healthy.

The nucleus functions as the control center of the cell, regulating cell activities and containing genetic material (DNA).
